sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः | स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रियः ||1||
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
anāśhritaḥ karma-phalaṁ kāryaṁ karma karoti yaḥ
sa sannyāsī cha yogī cha na niragnir na chākriyaḥ
translation: The Blessed Lord said: One who performs their duty without dependence on the fruits of action is a true renunciant and yogi, not one who merely renounces physical activities or rituals.

sanskrit: यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव | न ह्यसंन्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन ||2||
transliteration:
yaṁ sannyāsam iti prāhur yogaṁ taṁ viddhi pāṇḍava
na hy asannyasta-saṅkalpo yogī bhavati kaśchana
translation: What is called renunciation is the same as yoga, O Pandava. No one becomes a yogi without renouncing selfish desires.

sanskrit: आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते | योगारूढस्य तस्यैव शमः कारणमुच्यते ||3||
transliteration:
ārurukṣhor muner yogaṁ karma kāraṇam uchyate
yogārūḍhasya tasyaiva śhamaḥ kāraṇam uchyate
translation: For one who is just beginning the path of yoga, action is said to be the means. For one who is already elevated in yoga, renunciation of action is said to be the means.

sanskrit: यदा हि नेन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्जते | सर्वसङ्कल्पसंन्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते ||4||
transliteration:
yadā hi nendriyārtheṣhu na karmasv anuṣajjate
sarva-saṅkalpa-sannyāsī yogārūḍhas tadocyate
translation: When one is not attached to sense objects or actions and has renounced all desires, they are said to be elevated in yoga.

sanskrit: उद्धरेदात्मनात्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् | आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः ||5||
transliteration:
uddhared ātmanātmānaṁ nātmānam avasādayet
ātmaiva hy ātmano bandhur ātmaiva ripur ātmanaḥ
translation: Let a person lift themselves by their own mind, and not degrade themselves. The mind alone is the friend of the self, and the mind alone is the enemy of the self.

sanskrit: बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जितः | अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत् ||6||
transliteration:
bandhur ātmātmanas tasya yenātmaivātmanā jitaḥ
anātmanas tu śhatrutve vartetātmaiva śhatru-vat
translation: For one who has conquered the mind, the mind is the best of friends; but for one who has failed to do so, the mind will remain the greatest enemy.

sanskrit: जितात्मनः प्रशान्तस्य परमात्मा समाहितः | शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु तथा मानापमानयोः ||7||
transliteration:
jitātmanaḥ praśhāntasya paramātmā samāhitaḥ
śhītoṣhṇa-sukha-duḥkheṣhu tathā mānāpamānayoḥ
translation: The Supreme Self is perfectly realized by one who has conquered the mind and remains peaceful in cold and heat, pleasure and pain, honor and dishonor.

sanskrit: ज्ञानविज्ञानतृप्तात्मा कूटस्थो विजितेन्द्रियः | युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः ||8||
transliteration:
jñāna-vijñāna-tṛiptātmā kūṭa-stho vijitendriyaḥ
yukta ity uchyate yogī sama-loṣhṭāśhma-kāñchanaḥ
translation: One who is satisfied with knowledge and realization, who is self-controlled, and who sees a lump of earth, a stone, and gold as the same, is said to be truly united in yoga.

sanskrit: सुहृन्मित्रार्युदासीनमध्यस्थद्वेष्यबन्धुषु | साधुष्वपि च पापेषु समबुद्धिर्विशिष्यते ||9||
transliteration:
suhṛin-mitrāry-udāsīna-madhyastha-dveṣhya-bandhuṣhu
sādhuṣhv api cha pāpeṣhu sama-buddhir viśhiṣyate
translation: One who is equal-minded toward friends and enemies, the neutral and impartial, the hateful and the relatives, the righteous and the sinful, is distinguished among yogis.

sanskrit: योगी युञ्जीत सततमात्मानं रहसि स्थितः | एकाकी यतचित्तात्मा निराशीरपरिग्रहः ||10||
transliteration:
yogī yuñjīta satatam ātmānaṁ rahasi sthitaḥ
ekākī yata-chittātmā nirāśhīr aparigrahaḥ
translation: A yogi should constantly strive for self-realization, remaining in solitude, with a controlled mind and body, free from desires and possessions.

sanskrit: शुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मनः | नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम् ||11||
transliteration:
śhuchau deśhe pratiṣhṭhāpya sthiram āsanam ātmanaḥ
nātyuchchhritaṁ nāti-nīchaṁ chailājina-kuśhottaram
translation: In a clean and sacred place, establish a firm seat that is neither too high nor too low, covered with cloth, deerskin, and kusha grass.

sanskrit: तत्रैकाग्रं मनः कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रियः | उपविश्यासने युञ्ज्याद्योगमात्मविशुद्धये ||12||
transliteration:
tatraikāgraṁ manaḥ kṛitvā yata-chittendriya-kriyaḥ
upaviśhyāsane yuñjyād yogaṁ ātma-viśhuddhaye
translation: Sitting on that seat, with the mind focused and the senses controlled, one should practice yoga for the purification of the self.

sanskrit: समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिरः | सम्प्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन् ||13||
transliteration:
samaṁ kāya-śhiro-grīvaṁ dhārayann achalaṁ sthiraḥ
samprekṣhya nāsikāgraṁ svaṁ diśhaśh chānavalokayan
translation: Holding the body, head, and neck erect and still, gazing steadily at the tip of the nose without looking around...

sanskrit: प्रशान्तात्मा विगतभीर्ब्रह्मचारिव्रते स्थितः | मनः संयम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्परः ||14||
transliteration:
praśhāntātmā vigata-bhīr brahma-chāri-vrate sthitaḥ
manaḥ saṁyamya mach-chitto yukta āsīta mat-paraḥ
translation: With a serene mind, fearless, firm in the vow of celibacy, and focused on Me, the yogi should sit in meditation, devoted to Me.

sanskrit: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी नियतमानसः | शान्तिं निर्वाणपरमां मत्संस्थामधिगच्छति ||15||
transliteration:
yuñjann evaṁ sadātmānaṁ yogī niyata-mānasaḥ
śhāntiṁ nirvāṇa-paramāṁ mat-saṁsthām adhigachchhati
translation: Thus, constantly disciplining the mind, the yogi attains peace and the supreme liberation, which abides in Me.

sanskrit: नात्यश्नतस्तु योगोऽस्ति न चैकान्तमनश्नतः | न चातिस्वप्नशीलस्य जाग्रतो नैव चार्जुन ||16||
transliteration:
nātyaśhnatas tu yogo ’sti na chaikāntam anaśhnataḥ
na chāti-svapna-śhīlasya jāgrato naiva chārjuna
translation: There is no possibility of one's becoming a yogi, O Arjuna, if one eats too much or eats too little, sleeps too much or does not sleep enough.

sanskrit: युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु | युक्तस्वप्नावबोधस्य योगो भवति दुःखहा ||17||
transliteration:
yuktāhāra-vihārasya yukta-cheṣhṭasya karmasu
yukta-svapnāvabodhasya yogo bhavati duḥkha-hā
translation: He who is temperate in eating, sleeping, working, and recreation can mitigate all material pains by practicing the yoga system.

sanskrit: यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते | निःस्पृहः सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा ||18||
transliteration:
yadā viniyataṁ chittam ātmany evāvatiṣhṭhate
niḥspṛihaḥ sarva-kāmebhyo yukta ity uchyate tadā
translation: When the yogi, by practice of yoga, disciplines his mental activities and becomes situated in transcendence—devoid of all material desires—he is said to be well established in yoga.

sanskrit: यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता | योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मनः ||19||
transliteration:
yathā dīpo nivāta-stho neṅgate sopamā smṛitā
yogino yata-chittasya yuñjato yogam ātmanaḥ
translation: Just as a lamp in a windless place does not flicker, so the disciplined mind of a yogi remains steady in meditation on the Self.

sanskrit: यत्रोपरमते चित्तं निरुद्धं योगसेवया | यत्र चैवात्मनात्मानं पश्यन्नात्मनि तुष्यति ||20||
transliteration:
yatroparamate chittaṁ niruddhaṁ yoga-sevayā
yatra chaivātmanātmānaṁ paśhyann ātmani tuṣhyati
translation: When the mind, restrained by the practice of yoga, becomes still, and the yogi rejoices in the Self, then he is said to be established in yoga.

sanskrit: सुखमात्यन्तिकं यत्तद्बुद्धिग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम् | वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वतः ||21||
transliteration:
sukham ātyantikaṁ yat tad buddhi-grāhyam atīndriyam
vetti yatra na chaivāyaṁ sthitaśh chalati tattvataḥ
translation: In that joyous state, one experiences boundless transcendental happiness, realized through the purified intellect. Being established in this, one never departs from the truth.

sanskrit: यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं ततः | यस्मिन्स्थितो न दुःखेन गुरुणापि विचाल्यते ||22||
transliteration:
yaṁ labdhvā chāparaṁ lābhaṁ manyate nādhikaṁ tataḥ
yasmin sthito na duḥkhena guruṇāpi vichālyate
translation: Having gained this, one thinks there is no greater gain. Being situated in it, one is not shaken even by the heaviest sorrow.

sanskrit: तं विद्याद्दुःखसंयोगवियोगं योगसञ्ज्ञितम् | स निश्चयेन योक्तव्यो योगोऽनिर्विण्णचेतसा ||23||
transliteration:
taṁ vidyād duḥkha-saṁyoga-viyogaṁ yoga-saṁjñitam
sa niśhchayena yoktavyo yogo ’nirviṇṇa-chetasā
translation: That state, which is free from contact with sorrow, is known as yoga. This yoga should be practiced with determination and an unwavering mind.

sanskrit: सङ्कल्पप्रभवान्कामांस्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषतः | मनसैवेन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्ततः ||24||
transliteration:
saṅkalpa-prabhavān kāmāns tyaktvā sarvān aśheṣhataḥ
manasaivendriya-grāmaṁ viniyamya samantataḥ
translation: Completely renouncing all desires born of mental speculation, and thus restraining the senses on all sides by the mind...

sanskrit: शनैः शनैरुपरमेद्बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया | आत्मसंस्थं मनः कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् ||25||
transliteration:
śhanaiḥ śhanair uparamed buddhyā dhṛiti-gṛihītayā
ātma-saṁsthaṁ manaḥ kṛitvā na kiñchid api chintayet
translation: Gradually, step by step, with full conviction, one should become situated in trance by means of intelligence, and thus the mind should be fixed on the Self alone, without thinking of anything else.

sanskrit: यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम् | ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत् ||26||
transliteration:
yato yato niśhcharati manaśh chañchalam asthiram
tatas tato niyamyaitad ātmany eva vaśhaṁ nayet
translation: Wherever the mind wanders, being unsteady and restless, one should subdue it and bring it under the control of the Self alone.

sanskrit: प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम् | उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम् ||27||
transliteration:
praśhānta-manasam hy enaṁ yoginaṁ sukham uttamam
upaiti śhānta-rajasaṁ brahma-bhūtam akalmaṣham
translation: The yogi whose mind is calm, whose passions are subdued, and who is free from sin, experiences the highest happiness and becomes one with Brahman.

sanskrit: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मषः | सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्नुते ||28||
transliteration:
yuñjann evaṁ sadātmānaṁ yogī vigata-kalmaṣhaḥ
sukhena brahma-saṁsparśham atyantaṁ sukham aśhnute
translation: Thus, the yogi who is free from sin, constantly engaging the mind in yoga, enjoys unlimited bliss through contact with the Supreme.

sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि | ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः ||29||
transliteration:
sarva-bhūta-stham ātmānaṁ sarva-bhūtāni chātmani
īkṣhate yoga-yuktātmā sarvatra sama-darśhanaḥ
translation: The true yogi sees the Self in all beings and all beings in the Self. Such a person sees everything with an equal vision.

sanskrit: यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति | तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति ||30||
transliteration:
yo māṁ paśhyati sarvatra sarvaṁ cha mayi paśhyati
tasyāhaṁ na praṇaśhyāmi sa cha me na praṇaśhyati
translation: For one who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me, I am never lost, nor is he ever lost to Me.

sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः | सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते ||31||
transliteration:
sarva-bhūta-sthitaṁ yo māṁ bhajaty ekatvam āsthitaḥ
sarvathā vartamāno ’pi sa yogī mayi vartate
translation: The yogi who worships Me, dwelling in all beings, lives in Me, whatever his mode of life may be.

sanskrit: आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन | सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः ||32||
transliteration:
ātmaupamyena sarvatra samaṁ paśhyati yo ’rjuna
sukhaṁ vā yadi vā duḥkhaṁ sa yogī paramo mataḥ
translation: O Arjuna, the supreme yogi is one who regards all beings as equal, in both happiness and distress, by comparing them with himself.

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | योऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्तः साम्येन मधुसूदन | एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम् ||33||
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
yo ’yaṁ yogas tvayā proktaḥ sāmyena madhusūdana
etasyāhaṁ na paśhyāmi chañchalatvāt sthitiṁ sthirām
translation: Arjuna said: O Madhusudana, the system of yoga which You have described appears impractical and unendurable to me, for the mind is restless and unsteady.

sanskrit: चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद्दृढम् | तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम् ||34||
transliteration:
chañchalaṁ hi manaḥ kṛiṣhṇa pramāthi balavad dṛiḍham
tasyāhaṁ nigrahaṁ manye vāyor iva su-duṣhkaram
translation: The mind is very restless, turbulent, strong, and obstinate, O Krishna. Controlling it, I think, is more difficult than controlling the wind.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | असंशयं महाबाहो मनो दुर्निग्रहं चलम् | अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते ||35||
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
asaṁśhayaṁ mahā-bāho mano durnigrahaṁ chalam
abhyāsena tu kaunteya vairāgyeṇa cha gṛihyate
translation: The Blessed Lord said: O mighty-armed Arjuna, undoubtedly the mind is difficult to control and restless, but it can be conquered by practice and detachment.

sanskrit: असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः | वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायतः ||36||
transliteration:
asaṁyatātmanā yogo duṣprāpa iti me matiḥ
vaśyātmanā tu yatatā śhakyo ’vāptum upāyataḥ
translation: In my opinion, for one whose mind is unbridled, self-realization is difficult work. But he whose mind is controlled and who strives by proper means is assured of success. That is my opinion.

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | अयतिः श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्चलितमानसः | अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति ||37||
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
ayatiḥ śhraddhayopeto yogāch chalita-mānasaḥ
aprāpya yoga-saṁsiddhiṁ kāṁ gatiṁ kṛiṣhṇa gachchhati
translation: Arjuna said: O Krishna, what is the fate of the unsuccessful yogi who begins the path with faith but who does not persevere due to an unsteady mind?

sanskrit: कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति | अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मणः पथि ||38||
transliteration:
kachchin nobhaya-vibhraṣhṭaśh chhinnābhram iva naśhyati
apratiṣhṭho mahā-bāho vimūḍho brahmaṇaḥ pathi
translation: O mighty-armed Krishna, does not such a person, being deviated from both the spiritual and material paths, perish like a cloud torn from both ends, without any support?

sanskrit: एतन्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषतः | त्वदन्यः संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते ||39||
transliteration:
etan me sanśhayaṁ kṛiṣhṇa chettum arhasy aśheṣhataḥ
tvad anyaḥ sanśhayasyāsya chettā na hy upapadyate
translation: This is my doubt, O Krishna, and I ask You to dispel it completely. No one but You can destroy this doubt.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | पार्थ नैवेह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते | न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद्दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति ||40||
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
pārtha naiveha nāmutra vināśhas tasya vidyate
na hi kalyāṇa-kṛit kaśhchid durgatiṁ tāta gachchhati
translation: The Blessed Lord said: O Partha, a person engaged in auspicious acts does not meet with destruction either in this world or the next. One who does good is never overcome by evil.

sanskrit: प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वतीः समाः | शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते ||41||
transliteration:
prāpya puṇya-kṛitāṁ lokān uṣhitvā śhāśvatīḥ samāḥ
śhuchīnāṁ śhrīmatāṁ gehe yoga-bhraṣhṭo ’bhijāyate
translation: The unsuccessful yogi, after many years of enjoyment on the heavenly planets, is born into a family of righteous and wealthy people.

sanskrit: अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम् | एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम् ||42||
transliteration:
athavā yoginām eva kule bhavati dhīmatām
etad dhi durlabhataraṁ loke janma yad īdṛiśham
translation: Or he takes birth in a family of wise transcendentalists. Such a birth is very rare in this world.

sanskrit: तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम् | यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन ||43||
transliteration:
tatra taṁ buddhi-saṁyogaṁ labhate paurva-dehikam
yatate cha tato bhūyaḥ saṁsiddhau kuru-nandana
translation: There he regains the knowledge acquired in his previous life, and he strives again for perfection, O joy of the Kurus.

sanskrit: पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि सः | जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते ||44||
transliteration:
pūrvābhyāsena tenaiva hriyate hy avaśho ’pi saḥ
jijñāsur api yogasya śhabda-brahmātivartate
translation: By virtue of the previous practice, he is carried forward even without effort. Even the seeker of yoga transcends the Vedic rituals.

sanskrit: प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संशुद्धकिल्बिषः | अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ||45||
transliteration:
prayatnād yatamānas tu yogī sanśhuddha-kilbiṣhaḥ
aneka-janma-saṁsiddhas tato yāti parāṁ gatim
translation: But the yogi who strives with determination, purified of all sins, after many births, attains the supreme goal.

sanskrit: तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानिभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिकः | कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन ||46||
transliteration:
tapasvibhyo ’dhiko yogī jñānibhyo ’pi mato ’dhikaḥ
karmibhyaśh chādhiko yogī tasmād yogī bhavārjuna
translation: A yogi is greater than the ascetic, greater than the learned, and greater than the ritualist. Therefore, O Arjuna, be a yogi.

sanskrit: योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना | श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः ||47||
transliteration:
yoginām api sarveṣhāṁ mad-gatenāntar-ātmanā
śhraddhāvān bhajate yo māṁ sa me yuktatamo mataḥ
translation: Of all yogis, the one who worships Me with faith, with the mind absorbed in Me, is considered by Me to be the most devoted and the highest of all.
